instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2279: What is 820-2279? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.5V_S5: What is 5V_S5? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S5” which is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 state. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook White <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2279</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
Customer History: He plugged a MagSafe which he says it was in SHORT and then the macbook shut off forever

First I replaced the DC-IN

Assuming that 16.72V was wrong at PP18V5

However with a new one it showed up the same value

We do have DIM GREENLIGHT

Some of my measurements

PP18V5          16.72V
PP3V42          3.39V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>        12.56v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>        5V

threads.title: Macbook White <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2279</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
A shorted charger, can't damage the laptop; it will not deliver voltage at all.
Fake chinese charger, delivers max voltage all the time.
It can damage SMC through <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> line, or at least its protection circuit.

Post <TRANSISTOR>Q6940</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U6990</CHIP> voltages.
You've mentioned <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL>, what about <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: Macbook White <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2279</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
Macbook White <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2279</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q6940</TRANSISTOR> is bad probably.
I bet <CHIP>U6990</CHIP> is shorted to ground on pin 5.
Must change both of them.

threads.title: Macbook White <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2279</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
I do not have a spare board of this model and searching for the schematic they are different.

Can I use any component from a spare board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> or <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>? 

I think they are newer versions of this IC but not sure if able to use on older boards

threads.title: Macbook White <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2279</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: You can't find these components in the mentioned boards.
